Robert Sayre wrote:

> ...neither is JSON. You were discussing properties of evaluators.
> 

In theory JSON is not Turing complete. In practice, it is.

JSON is JavaScript, and JavaScript is Turing complete. You're not 
supposed to put stuff arbitrary JavaScript into  JSON, but people can 
and do. eval-able formats are dangerous. Formats that mix data and code 
are dangerous. That's the bottom line.

--
